page.title: 10DUMFRIES IN THE 1920's
page.content: On the 17 June 1985, we went to Nithbank hospital which is for the elderly. We talked to Mrs McConville who is 83 years old. She has lived in Dumfries all her life, and she told us what it was like from the 1920's onwards. {LIVING CONDITIONS Mrs McConville told us that Dumfries used to be a little village in the country with horses and carts instead of cars. The houses were tenaments in rows and they were very small and cramped. People lived on both sides of the River Nith. Wednesdays were market days and the stalls were on the High Street at the Midsteeple. Lots of visitors came on a Wednesday to the market.
